page.title: 06The Royal Military Canal
page.content: On Sunday 14 October 1804 John Brown went to Hythe. On the way he stopped at the Star Inn in Maidstone. John Brown met the contractors and went to the White Inn to dine. This is how the building of the{Royal Military Canal was first planned. The Royal Military Canal was built in the Napoleonic War. The promoter was{William Pitt. { { }They built the canal because the enemies would not be able to get over it so the people were safe. It was sixty feet wide at the top and forty at the bottom and nine feet deep. The Canal is now used for boats. The Canal is very muddy and weedy and looks dirty. The Canal is pretty to walk along. Many people fish in the Canal.
